## DataShareConsumerAssociation Resource Properties {#properties}

To learn more about resource properties and how to use them, see [Inputs and Outputs](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) in the Architecture and Concepts docs.

### Inputs

<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="python">
<p>
In Python, inputs that are objects can be passed either as <a href="/docs/languages-sdks/python/#inputs-and-outputs">argument classes or as dictionary literals</a>.

</pulumi-choosable>

The DataShareConsumerAssociation resource accepts the following [input](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) properties:



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="datasharearn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#datasharearn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Data<wbr>Share<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the datashare that the consumer is to use with the account or the namespace.</p>
<p>The following arguments are optional:</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowwrites_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowwrites_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Allow<wbr>Writes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether to allow write operations for a datashare.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="associateentireaccount_csharp">

## Look up Existing DataShareConsumerAssociation Resource {#look-up}

Get an existing DataShareConsumerAssociation resource's state with the given name, ID, and optional extra properties used to qualify the lookup.
<div>
<pulumi-chooser type="language" options="csharp,go,typescript,python,yaml,java"></pulumi-chooser>
</div>

The following state arguments are supported:


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_allowwrites_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_allowwrites_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Allow<wbr>Writes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether to allow write operations for a datashare.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_associateentireaccount_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_associateentireaccount_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Associate<wbr>Entire<wbr>Account</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether the datashare is associated with the entire account. Conflicts with <code>consumer_arn</code> and <code>consumer_region</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_consumerarn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_consumerarn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Consumer<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the consumer that is associated with the datashare. Conflicts with <code>associate_entire_account</code> and <code>consumer_region</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_consumerregion_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_consumerregion_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Consumer<wbr>Region</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>From a datashare consumer account, associates a datashare with all existing and future namespaces in the specified AWS Region. Conflicts with <code>associate_entire_account</code> and <code>consumer_arn</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_datasharearn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_datasharearn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Data<wbr>Share<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the datashare that the consumer is to use with the account or the namespace.</p>
<p>The following arguments are optional:</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_managedby_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_managedby_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Managed<wbr>By</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Identifier of a datashare to show its managing entity.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_producerarn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_producerarn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Producer<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

    <dd>From a datashare consumer account, associates a datashare with all existing and future namespaces in the specified AWS Region. Conflicts with <code>associate_entire_account</code> and <code>consumer_arn</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_datasharearn_nodejs">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the datashare that the consumer is to use with the account or the namespace.</p>
<p>The following arguments are optional:</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_managedby_nodejs">

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Redshift Data Share Consumer Association using the `id`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:redshift/dataShareConsumerAssociation:DataShareConsumerAssociation example arn:aws:redshift:us-west-2:123456789012:datashare:b3bfde75-73fd-408b-9086-d6fccfd6d588/example,,,us-west-2
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
